metadata.title: CVE-2021-25290 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Certified (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
An issue was discovered in Pillow before 8.1.1. In TiffDecode.c, there is anegative-offset memcpy with an invalid size.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-25290` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

python3-pil - 7.0.0-4ubuntu0.3
python3-pil.imagetk - 7.0.0-4ubuntu0.3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: pillow package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '7.0.0-4ubuntu0.3').
pillow-python2 package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
